snippet: Executives at the Russian gas giant Gazprom now say Ukraine owes them more than $22 billion, adding economic pressure to the military presence along Ukraine’s eastern border.
abstract: Executives at Russian gas giant Gazprom say Ukraine owes them more than $22 billion, adding economic pressure to the military presence along Ukraine’s eastern border; behind payment demands is a warning that Gazprom will cut off gas supplies to Ukraine, which it has done at least twice before, in 2006 and 2009, over political and financial disputes.

byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin, and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Executives at the Russian gas giant Gazprom now say Ukraine owes them more than $22 billion, adding economic pressure to the military presence along Ukraine’s eastern border.

headline.main: Russia Ratchets Up Ukraine’s Gas Bills in Shift to an Economic Battlefield
headline.print_headline: Russia Ratchets Up Ukraine’s Gas Bills in Shift to an Economic Battlefield
